dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Berik Sholpankulov, the Deputy Governor of the National Bank of Kazakhstan, just had to some pretty intense questions from journalists.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Deputy Governor of the National Bank of Kazakhstan Berik Sholpankulov has dismissed as rumors recent claims circulating on social media about unexplained withdrawals from citizens' bank accounts. During a briefing, journalists raised concerns over multiple complaints from users who alleged that funds had disappeared from their accounts via mobile banking apps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that—rumors are flying about money disappearing from people's accounts through mobile banking apps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and he was pretty firm, like, he said it's highly unlikely, money doesn't just vanish.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such incidents are highly unlikely. Money doesn't just disappear.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he mentioned that even if there's a technical glitch, banks have to restore the funds—all the data is archived.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he mentioned that even if there's a technical glitch, banks have to restore the funds-all the data is archived.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If there's a technical malfunction, the bank is responsible for restoring the affected funds. All data is archived, and in the event of a system failure, everything is recoverable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But you know, social media's been flooded with these complaints, so it's understandable people are worried.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's that other issue he brought up—about second-tier banks blocking accounts over overdue loans.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also addressed frequent complaints on social media about second-tier banks blocking accounts of customers with overdue loans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he clarified that accounts aren't fully frozen though; essential funds have to stay accessible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he clarified that accounts aren't fully frozen though; essential funds have to stay accessible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, accounts are not fully frozen—funds necessary for essential needs must remain accessible," Sholpankulov explained.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, but still, if you're the customer, it must feel pretty stressful, right?

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And he pointed out that these actions are actually in the terms of service—people might not realize that when they sign up.

dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, and he mentioned the Senate is looking into regulating some of these practices now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, 'cause let's be honest, rumors can really spiral and cause panic for no reason.
